item.title: Cohere hires long-time Meta research head Joelle Pineau as its chief AI officer
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Cohere has hired Joelle Pineau, Meta's former VP of AI research who previously oversaw the tech giant's fundamental AI research (FAIR) lab. In her newly created Chief AI Officer role, Pineau will oversee AI strategy across Cohere's research, product and policy teams.

item.title: Inside the Box: Aaron Levie on reinvention at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: Aaron Levie of Box joins the Disrupt Stage at TechCrunch Disrupt 2025 in October.

item.title: Apple’s blood oxygen monitoring returns to its latest Apple Watches
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The change doesn’t affect previously sold models with the original version of the feature or units bought outside the U.S.

item.title: Airbnb will allow US users book stays without paying upfront
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Airbnb has launched a new feature called "Reserve Now, Pay Later" that lets users in the U.S. reserve a property without paying upfront, potentially allowing people to cancel their bookings with less hassle if their plans change.

item.title: Co-founder of Elon Musk’s xAI departs the company
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Igor Babuschkin is leaving xAI less than three years after he co-founded the startup with Elon Musk, following a series of scandals at company.

item.title: Waymo finally has a music experience worthy of its robotaxi
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description: Waymo now lets you stream music straight from Spotify, which makes the back seat of a robotaxi feel more like your own private space.

item.title: Google CEO adds a new calendar feature at Stripe co-founder’s request
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: While users often tag companies and CEOs with online feedback and complaints, you know you've made it when the CEO not only replies to you, but also implements the change you've asked for.

item.title: India’s Rapido begins testing food delivery to take on Swiggy, Zomato
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: Rapido's beta food delivery service has popped up in three key localities in Bengaluru before a broader rollout.

item.title: Instagram is developing a feature that helps users find shared interests
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: People select their favorite movies, books, TV shows, games, and music, or their "Picks." Instagram then finds overlaps with friends who chose the same things.

item.title: Monarch Tractors won’t be built by Foxconn after Ohio factory sale
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Monarch's tractors were the only vehicles being built by Foxconn in Ohio after Lordstown Motors, Fisker Inc., and IndiEV went bankrupt.

item.title: NASA has sparked a race to develop the data pipeline to Mars
item.dc:creator: Aria Alamalhodaei
item.description: SpaceX, Blue Origin, and Rocket Lab are competing to become the de facto comms provider for Mars.

item.title: Pocket FM gives its writers an AI tool to transform narratives, write cliffhangers, and more
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Pocket FM is building LLM to help users write faster and in turn, produce more audio shows.

item.title: Pebble’s smartwatch is back: Pebble Time 2 specs revealed
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The Pebble Time 2's final smartwatch specs are revealed. (And yes, you can call it a "Pebble" again!)

item.title: Anthropic nabs Humanloop team as competition for enterprise AI talent heats up
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: While an Anthropic spokesperson confirmed that the AI firm did not acquire Humanloop or its IP, that’s a moot point in an industry where IP lives in the brain. And what Humanloop’s team is bringing to Anthropic is experience developing the tools that help enterprises run safe, reliable AI at scale.

item.title: Tony Robbins and Peter Diamandis’ longevity company Fountain Life raises $18M
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: The first principal of longevity is, “Don't die of anything stupid,” CEO Dr. William Kapp says. New funding will support mulit-state expansion.

item.title: Amazon rolls out same-day delivery of perishable groceries in 1,000 US cities
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: Shoppers can now order fresh grocery items, including produce, dairy, meat, seafood, baked goods, and more, alongside everyday household products, electronics, and other items available for same-day delivery.

item.title: How we found TeaOnHer spilling users’ driver’s licenses in less than 10 minutes
item.dc:creator: Zack Whittaker
item.description: Exclusive: A dating gossip app for men exposed thousands of users' personal data, including scans of driver's licenses. The app's developer, Xavier Lampkin, won't say if he plans to notify affected users about the app's security lapse.

item.title: Apple dismisses Elon Musk’s claims that App Store favors OpenAI over other AI apps
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: The response comes after Musk threatened to sue Apple via xAI, claiming the iPhone maker was “behaving in a manner that makes it impossible for any AI company besides OpenAI to reach #1 in the App Store.”

item.title: Why I finally left Spotify
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: Spotify's dependence on algorithmic recommendations has gotten too suffocating.

item.title: NeoLogic wants to build more energy-efficient CPUs for AI data centers
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: To fund its vision of building more energy-efficient server CPUs, NeoLogic recently raised a $10 million Series A round led by KOMPAS VC with participation from M Ventures, Maniv Mobility, and lool Ventures.
